member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode
member.summary: OCR (Optical Character Recognition) usage mode.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.Off
member.summary: Off. No OCR is used.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.Auto
member.summary: Similar to TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndFonts but checks if the page contains only raster images to decide if need to use OCR. Runs OCR only if page contains very few text and one or more raster images. The result contains text objects produced from images and vector drawings.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndFonts
member.summary: Always runs OCR to extract text from images and vector drawings (if any). See also .TextFromImagesAndFonts mode to read from objects except vector drawings. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images and vector drawings using OCR functionality if any.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndRepairedFonts
member.summary: Special mode: extracts text from images and vector drawings and repairs text from fonts fixing the incorrect encoding. Some PDF files contain visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like that using the OCR functionality. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images and vector drawings using OCR functionality if any.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromRepairedFontsOnly
member.summary: Special mode: repairs text objects with incorrect encoding using OCR functionality. Images and vectors are not processed in this mode. Some PDF files contains visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like this using OCR function. This mode returns repaired text objects only (no images or vector drawings are processed).

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndRepairedFonts
member.summary: Special mode: extracts text from raster images (but skips vector drawings) and repairs text objects with incorrect encoding Some PDF files contains visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like this using the OCR functionality. This mode returns repaired text objects and text objects produced from raster images (no vector drawings are processed).

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndFonts
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images (but skips vector drawings) plus the text objects. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images (but no vector drawings are processed) using OCR functionality.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images (but skips vector drawings) plus the text objects. The result contains text extracted from images only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromVectorsOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from vector drawings only. The result contains text objects from vector drawings only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images and vector drawings only. no text from pdf objects is included. The result contains text objects from vector drawings only.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode
member.summary: OCR results caching behavior. Turned off by default (no cache is used). In "WholePage" caching mode you may save processing time as the SDK will check if need to re-run OCR on the page or can just pull results from previously cached OCR results.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode.Off
member.summary: No caching.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode.WholePage
member.summary: Entire page is cached. When reading data from regions of the page, the text will be taken from the cache.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode
member.summary: Sets if lines are not checked to be merged, can be merged by rows, or inside columns

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.None
member.summary: No line grouping. Each line is processed as a single row.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.GroupByRows
member.summary: Each row is checked against next row to see if these rows can be grouped. Rows will be grouped only if all cells in the current row are allowed to be grouped with all cells in next row.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.GroupByColumns
member.summary: Each cell is checked against cell below in next row to see if the can be grouped. Cells will be grouped inside the same column even if cells in another columns can't be grouped.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.JoinOrphanedRows
member.summary: Join row with a single cell up to previous row if there is no separator between them.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode
member.summary: Defines how columns are detected on the document page.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.ContentGroupsAndBorders
member.summary: (0) Analyses grouping of text objects and vertical column separators (vertical lines). Default mode.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.ContentGroups
member.summary: (1) Analyses only the grouping of text objects. Mostly useful for tables without separating lines between rows and columns.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.Borders
member.summary: (2) Analyses only separating lines between rows and columns. Useful only with tables with explicit vector separators between rows and columns. Also helpful with documents with multiple tables on one page.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.BorderedTables
member.summary: (3) Uses optical recognition to detect tables with closed outer borders and row/column separators inside them. Especially useful for working with scanned documents. May work slower than other modes due to optical recognition.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisStatus
member.summary: Defines statuses of the text analysis. See .

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisStatus.TextIsTooShort
member.summary: Text is too short for analysis. Results have low confidence. 1000 or more characters is required for reliable results.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisStatus.Valid
member.summary: The results of the analysis are quite reliable.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisResults
member.summary: Text analysis results.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisResults.AnalysisStatus
member.summary: Status of analysis. See .

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisResults.IsEnglishText
member.summary: Gets whether the extracted text is in English language.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextAnalysisResults.IsTextCorrupted
member.summary: Gets whether the extracted English text is corrupted. This may be a consequence of PDF document defects causing impossibility of valid text extraction. You may need to forcibly extract this document using the optical recognition (OCR). Set property to to force the OCR.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor
member.summary: Defines a base class for text-related PDF extractors.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.XCoordinateToleranceFactor
member.summary: X coordinate tolerance factor.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.YCoordinateToleranceFactor
member.summary: Y coordinate tolerance factor.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TableXMinIntersectionRequiredInPercents
member.summary: Structured extraction (CSV, XML, XLS, StructuredExtractor, TextExtractor with PreserveFormatting = true) This option controls how much % of the cell's rectangle should intersect (by X coordinate axis) with previous cell to treat both cells belonging to the same column.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TableYMinIntersectionRequiredInPercents
member.summary: Y coordinate tolerance factor when working with stuctured (table) data. This option controls how much % of the cell rectangle (by Y coordinate) should intersect with row to belong to it.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.RTLTextAutoDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Enables RTL (Right-To-Left) text auto detection.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractInvisibleText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract invisible text from PDF document.
member.value: true if extract invisible text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractShadowLikeText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include characters used to create "shadow" effect (when the same character appears with some offset) from PDF document. True by default (includes all encoded characters disregarding their real appearance).
member.value: true if extract shadow like characters in text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text from annotation objects. Default is true.
member.value: true if extract annotations; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.AutoAlignColumnsToHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to auto align text in columns while extracting text (with formatting preserved), csv, xml or not. True by default (i.e. align text in columns and header). False means to not auto align text and try to reproduce the original table.
member.value: true if try to auto align text in columns for text (with formatting), csv, xml, xls extraction. Set to false to provide more precise representation of the original table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the text formatting on the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.DetectLinesInsteadOfParagraphs
member.summary: Lines detection option. Obsolete: Use instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TrimSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to remove trailing and ending spaces from table cell values.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractColumnByColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text column by column or use the visual layout of the text while extracting. False by default. if you are processing PDF newspapers with text columns, set this property to True so you get column by column instead of line by line
member.value: true if extract column by column; otherwise extracts line by line (default), false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.DetectNewColumnBySpacesRatio
member.summary: Space ratio between words.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontNames
member.summary: Consider font names in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontSizes
member.summary: Consider font sizes in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontColors
member.summary: Consider font colors in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderVerticalBorders
member.summary: Consider vertical borders in document text when detecting table structure and merging text objects. True by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractionColumns
member.summary: Contains columns detected from last processed document page.
member.value: Array of column coordinates.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.CustomExtractionColumns
member.summary: Allows to override the automatic columns detection with custom columns.
member.value: Array of column coordinates (left column edges). The first coordinate should be 0 or left edge of the most left text object.
member.remarks: Example of use: If you have a document with the same column structure on all pages, you can run the extraction for the first page, take detected columns from it using property and pass them to CustomExtractionColumns. This will help to avoid columns variation caused by minor changes in other pages structure and also will speed up the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.LineGroupingMode
member.summary: Sets how lines are grouped into paragraphs. Default: None (no lines grouping is performed).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.Unwrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to unwrap lines into single lines or not (especially could be useful in the column layout mode - see ExtractColumnByColumn property). Default is False.
member.remarks: Unwrapping works only when the formatting keeping is disabled (PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction property is set to False).
member.value: true if unwrap lines; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.RemoveHyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically remove hyphenations in end of lines (works when Unwrap is True).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode
member.summary: Sets how columns are detected. Default: ContentGroupsAndBorders (columns are detected based on content groups and borders (vertical lines)).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TextEncodingCodePage
member.summary: Sets the default text encoding. Default encoding is "iso-8859-1".
member.remarks: You can find the full list of code pages at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.text.encodinginfo.getencoding(v=vs.110).aspx

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to rotate document pages to specified angle before the extraction.
member.remarks: You should specify this property before the document loading.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ShrinkMultipleSpaces
member.summary: Replaces multiple spaces in text objects with a single space. Multiple spaces affect the detection of columns, so removing them can improve the result. Default is false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.EnableTextAnalysis
member.summary: Enables or disables extracted text analysis. Check after the extraction for analysis results.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TextAnalysisResults
member.summary: Results of the text analysis. Enable the analysis using property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of JPEG compressed images.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OptimizationOptions.ResampleImages
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to resample (resize) high-resolution images. Images with the resolution larger than will be resampled at . Default is true. Helps to optimize (reduce the file size) PDF documents containing high resolution scanned images (300DPI or more) at the expense of text sharpness.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OptimizationOptions.ResamplingResolution
member.summary: Resampling resolution. Default is 120 DPI. All images of higher resolution will be resampled to it.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor
member.summary: Defines a base interface for PDF text extractors.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRMode
member.summary:
Enables Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to recognize text from embedded images. Set the language using property.
This option requires Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRExtension.dll assembly and appropriate language files in folder. The SDK is shipped with language files for English, French, German and Spanish. You can download more languages at https://github.com/bytescout/ocrdata.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRCacheMode
member.summary: OCR results caching behaviour. Turned off by default (no cache is used). In "WholePage" caching mode you may save processing time as the SDK will check if need to re-run OCR on the page or can just pull results from previously cached OCR results.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRLanguageDataFolder
member.summary: Folder containing OCR language data files.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRLanguage
member.summary:
Language for Optical Character Recognition (OCR). The valid values are: ValueLanguage
"eng"English (default)
"deu"German
"fra"French
"spa"Spanish
Download more languages at https://github.com/bytescout/ocrdata.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRResolution
member.summary: Resolution of Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Default is 300 DPI.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRAutoModeMinExistingTextLength
member.summary: Applies to OCRMode.Auto only: Min total length of existing text on current page to decide if OCR should be run or not. If the length of text is lesser than this property then library runs OCR for this page. Otherwise it extracts the existing text only.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRDetectPageRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to detect scanned page rotation. Slightly slows down the processing time.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRMaximizeCPUUtilization
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum OCR performance using Intel OpenMP (if available) to accelerate to approximately 30%. Default is false.
member.remarks: This option improves OCR performance by approximately 30% at the cost of maximum CPU utilization. If your application is for a desktop or a dedicated server, feel free to enable this option. But if you run the application on shared virtual hosting, the maximized CPU utilization may be undesirable.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCROverallConfidence
member.summary: Gets overall OCR confidence. This value is calculated after the extraction is performed.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRImagePreprocessingFilters
member.summary: Collection of image processing filters applied to the document page before Optical Character Recognition (OCR). May improve the recognition quality.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRCorrections
member.summary: Collection of corrections automatically applied to recognized text to fix repeating recognition errors.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.IsOCRRecommendedForPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Detects whether OCR is recommended for specified page. OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is recommended when pages has no text objects bat has an image that might contain text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRWhiteList
member.summary: OCRWhiteList property allows to define a list of characters allowed to be recognized from scanned document. Only characters from this list will appear in the result text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseOCRExtractor.OCRBlackList
member.summary: OCRBlackList property allows to define a list of characters not allowed to be recognized from scanned document. The resulting text will only contain characters that are not in this list.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor
member.summary: Defines a base interface for PDF text extractors.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.XCoordinateToleranceFactor
member.summary: Sets X coordinate tolerance to use when reproducing the structure of PDF page content.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.YCoordinateToleranceFactor
member.summary: Sets Y coordinate tolerance to use when reproducing the structure of PDF page content.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.TableXMinIntersectionRequiredInPercents
member.summary: Structured extraction (CSV, XML, XLS, StructuredExtractor, TextExtractor with PreserveFormatting = true) This option controls how much % of the cell's rectangle should intersect (by X coordinate axis) with previous cell to treat both cells belonging to the same column.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.TableYMinIntersectionRequiredInPercents
member.summary: Structured extraction (CSV, XML, XLS, StructuredExtractor, TextExtractor with PreserveFormatting = true) This option controls how much % of the cell's rectangle should intersect (by Y coordinate axis) with previous cell to treat both cells belonging to the same row.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.RTLTextAutoDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Enables RTL (Right-To-Left) text auto detection.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ExtractInvisibleText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract invisible text from PDF document.
member.value: true if extract invisible text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ExtractShadowLikeText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include characters used to create "shadow" effect (when the same character appears with some offset) from PDF document. True by default (includes all encoded characters disregarding their real appearance).
member.value: true if extract shadow like characters in text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ExtractAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text from annotation objects. Default is true.
member.value: true if extract annotations; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.DetectLinesInsteadOfParagraphs
member.summary: Lines detection option. Obsolete: Use instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.LineGroupingMode
member.summary: When grouping text, each new line of text will start a new group (rather than paragraph grouping) Default: None. (no merging is done. Just processing line by line).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode
member.summary: Sets how columns are detected. Default: ContentGroupsAndBorders (columns are detected based on content groups and borders (vertical lines)).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.AutoAlignColumnsToHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to auto align text in columns while extracting text (with formatting preserved), csv, xml or not. True by default (i.e. align text in columns and header). False means to not auto align text and try to reproduce the original table.
member.value: true if try to auto align text in columns for text (with formatting), csv, xml, xls extraction. Set to false to provide more precise representation of the original table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.DetectNewColumnBySpacesRatio
member.summary: Space ratio between words.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ExtractColumnByColumn
member.summary: Indicates if we should extract text column by column or should we use the original layout.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.TrimSpaces
member.summary: Trim spaces from text lines (FALSE by default to preserve original formatting if any).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.Unwrap
member.summary: Unwraps lines in columns into one single. True by default

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.RemoveHyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically remove hyphenations in end of lines (works when Unwrap is True).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the text formatting on the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.TextEncodingCodePage

member.remarks: You can find the full list of code pages at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/en-en/library/system.text.encodinginfo.codepage(v=vs.110).aspx

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.RotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to rotate document pages to specified angle before the extraction.
member.remarks: Note, this option is ignored if property enabled.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontNames
member.summary: Consider font names in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontSizes
member.summary: Consider font sizes in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontColors
member.summary: Consider font colors in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ConsiderVerticalBorders
member.summary: Consider vertical borders colors in document text when detecting table structure and merging text objects. True by default.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.DisposePage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disposes the page object. Uses this method carefully to destroy the page object that should not be used further. Useful to free allocated memory when processing huge PDF documents.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ExtractionColumns
member.summary: Contains columns detected from last processed document page.
member.value: Array of column coordinates.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.CustomExtractionColumns
member.summary: Allows to override the automatic columns detection with custom columns.
member.value: Array of column coordinates.
member.remarks: Example of use: If you have a document with the same column structure on all pages, you can run the extraction for the first page, take detected columns from it using property and pass them to CustomExtractionColumns. This will allow to avoid columns varying caused by minor changes in other pages structure and also speed up the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IBaseTextExtractor.ShrinkMultipleSpaces
member.summary: Replaces multiple spaces in text objects with a single space. Multiple spaces affect the detection of columns, so removing them can improve the result. Default is false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRLanguage
member.summary:
Language for Optical Character Recognition (OCR). The valid values are: ValueLanguage
"eng"English (default)
"deu"German
"fra"French
"spa"Spanish
Download more languages at https://github.com/bytescout/ocrdata.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRLanguageDataFolder
member.summary: Folder containing OCR language data files.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRResolution
member.summary: Resolution of Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Default is 300 DPI.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRDetectPageRotation
member.summary: Detect scanned page rotation. Slightly slows down the processing time.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.KeepOriginalRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to keep the original rotation of the document after making it searchable. Default is false.
member.remarks: Works in conjunction with option that enables the rotation detection.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRMaximizeCPUUtilization
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum OCR performance using Intel OpenMP (if available) to accelerate to approximately 30%. Default is false.
member.remarks: This option improves OCR performance by approximately 30% at the cost of maximum CPU utilization. If your application is for a desktop or a dedicated server, feel free to enable this option. But if you run the application on shared virtual hosting, the maximized CPU utilization may be undesirable.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.LabelingFont
member.summary: Font used to put invisible text. By default "Helvetica" used, but this font does not contain Unicode character ranges. If you process document containing Chinese, Japanese, Korean characters (or any other Unicode charsets) you should set the font name containing required characters, for example, "Arial Unicode MS", "Microsoft JhengHei", etc.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.DiscardExistingDocumentText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to discard any existing text in the document. Default is false (combine the recognized text with existing content).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRImagePreprocessingFilters
member.summary: Collection of image processing filters applied to the document page before Optical Character Recognition (OCR). May improve the recognition quality.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCRCorrections
member.summary: Collection of corrections automatically applied to recognized text to fix repeating recognition errors.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ISearchablePDFMaker.OCROverallConfidence
member.summary: Gets overall OCR confidence. This value is calculated after the extraction is performed.

member.summary: Get or sets the image saving way: do not save; save to outer file; embed into result JSON as Base64 string. Default is ImageHandling.None.

member.summary: Gets or sets the folder to put extracted images when property is set to ImageHandling.OuterFile. Default is "images" - the extractor will create "images" sub-folder in the same folder with output JSON file.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format for extracted images. Default is PNG.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.KeepOriginalFontNames
member.summary: By default JSONExtractor replaces names of embedded fonts with standard (or "descendant") fonts similar by metrics and typeface. This is because embedded fonts differ from fonts installed into your system or absent there at all. Set this property to true if you want to keep the original font names.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.AllowStandalonePunctuation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow standalone punctuation characters. If false they will be merged with nearest text object.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.SaveVectors
member.summary: Get or sets whether to save vector objects. Default is false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.DetectUnderlineTextStyle
member.summary: Get or sets whether to detect the "underline" text style. Default is false.
member.remarks: PDF standard does not support the "underline" font style. All underlines you can see in PDF documents are drawn as vector lines over the text. DetectUnderlineTextStyle property enables the detection of the underline by analyzing relative locations of vector lines and text objects. This analysis can affect performance if the document page contains many vector lines, so the property is set to false by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IJSONExtractor.DetectStrikeoutTextStyle
member.summary: Get or sets whether to detect the "strikeout" text style. Default is false.
member.remarks: PDF standard does not support the "strikeout" font style. All strikeouts you can see in PDF documents are drawn as vector lines over the text. DetectStrikeoutTextStyle property enables the detection of the strikeout by analyzing relative locations of vector lines and text objects. This analysis can affect performance if the document page contains many vector lines, so the property is set to false by default.

member.summary: Tests if an item is contained in the tree.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TableDetectorPT.IntervalTree`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item.
member.returns: True if an item was removed
member.remarks: This method uses the collections objects Equals and CompareTo methods on item to retrieve the existing item. If there are duplicates of the item, then object reference is used to remove. If is not a reference type, then the first found equal interval will be removed.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IDocumentSplitter.Split(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits specified PDF or TIFF document to two documents at specified page.

Stream for the first output document.
Stream for the second output document.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IDocumentSplitter.Split(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Splits PDF or TIFF document to multiple documents according to specified ranges.
member.param: Comma-separated list of page ranges in form "1-4,5,7,8-15,16-". Page numbers are 1-based. Ending "-" means "to the last page". You can also use inverted page numbers adding '!' before the number. E.g. "!1" means "the last page", "2-!2" means "from the second to the penultimate page", "!2-" - last two pages". Also, you can also use single asterisk "*" character as the range to split the document into separate pages.
member.returns: List of files of generated document parts.
member.remarks: Output files are generated in the system temporary folder. Move them to desired folder programmatically.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IDocumentSplitter.Split(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Splits PDF or TIFF document to multiple documents according to specified ranges.
member.param: Comma-separated list of page ranges in form "1-4,5,7,8-15,16-". Page numbers are 1-based. Ending "-" means "to the last page". You can also use inverted page numbers adding '!' before the number. E.g. "!1" means "the last page", "2-!2" means "from the second to the penultimate page", "!2-" - last two pages". Also, you can also use single asterisk "*" character as the range to split the document into separate pages.
member.returns: List of files of generated document parts.
member.remarks: If the output folder does not exist, the method will try to create it.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IDocumentSplitter.Split(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Splits PDF or TIFF document to multiple documents according to the specified ranges.
member.param: The stream containing the input document.

Comma-separated list of page ranges in form "1-4,5,7,8-15,16-". Page numbers are 1-based. Ending "-" means "to the last page". You can also use inverted page numbers adding '!' before the number. E.g. "!1" means "the last page", "2-!2" means "from the second to the penultimate page", "!2-" - last two pages". Also, you can also use single asterisk "*" character as the range to split the document into separate pages.
member.returns: Array of buffers containing splitted parts.

BYTESCOUT IS NOT LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, LOSSES, COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENTS OR ANY OTHER CONSEQUENCES CAUSED BY IGNORING PERMISSIONS OF PDF DOCUMENT. BY CHANGING THIS OPTION YOU ARE CONFIRMING YOU ARE UNDERSTANDING ALL WRITTEN ABOVE AND DOING IT AT YOUR OWN RISK.

member.summary: Get or sets the image saving way: do not save; save to outer file; embed into result XML as Base64 string. Default is ImageHandling.None.

member.summary: Gets or sets the folder to put extracted images when property is set to ImageHandling.OuterFile. Default is "images" - the extractor will create "images" sub-folder in the same folder with output XML file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image format for extracted images. Default is PNG.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IXMLExtractor.KeepOriginalFontNames
member.summary: By default XMLExtractor replaces names of embedded fonts with standard (or "descendant") fonts similar by metrics and typeface. This is because embedded fonts differ from fonts installed into your system or absent there at all. Set this property to true if you want to keep the original font names.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow standalone punctuation characters. If false they will be merged with nearest text object.

member.summary: Get or sets whether to save vector objects. Default is false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IXMLExtractor.DetectUnderlineTextStyle
member.summary: Get or sets whether to detect the "underline" text style. Default is false.
member.remarks: PDF standard does not support the "underline" font style. All underlines you can see in PDF documents are drawn as vector lines over the text. DetectUnderlineTextStyle property enables the detection of the underline by analyzing relative locations of vector lines and text objects. This analysis can affect performance if the document page contains many vector lines, so the property is set to false by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.IXMLExtractor.DetectStrikeoutTextStyle
member.summary: Get or sets whether to detect the "strikeout" text style. Default is false.
member.remarks: PDF standard does not support the "strikeout" font style. All strikeouts you can see in PDF documents are drawn as vector lines over the text. DetectStrikeoutTextStyle property enables the detection of the strikeout by analyzing relative locations of vector lines and text objects. This analysis can affect performance if the document page contains many vector lines, so the property is set to false by default.

member.summary: Searches the document page for specified text.
member.remarks: Use property to get search result information (text, location, sub-elements). Use to change the word matching mode. Use if you need punctuation marks (dot, quotes etc) to be treated as part of word. Use to enable regular expressions (Regex).
member.param: Index of page to search in.
member.returns: true if the search string is found; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ITextExtractor.Find(System.Int32,System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions)
member.summary: Searches the document page for specified text in Regex mode with specified options.
member.remarks: Use property to get search result information (text, location, sub-elements). Use to change the word matching mode. Use if you need punctuation marks (dot, quotes etc) to be treated as part of word.
member.param: Index of page to search in.
member.returns: true if the search string is found; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ITextExtractor.FindNext
member.summary: Continues the text search started by method.
member.returns: true if search string is found; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ITextExtractor.FindAll(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for all occurrences of specified text in specified document page or in entire document.
member.remarks: Use to change the word matching mode. Use if you need punctuation marks (dot, quotes etc) to be treated as part of word. Use to enable regular expressions (Regex).
member.param: Index of page for searching. Use -1 to search the entire document.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ITextExtractor.FindAllToJSON(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for all occurrences of specified text in specified document page or in entire document and returns result as JSON string.
member.remarks: Use to change the word matching mode. Use if you need punctuation marks (dot, quotes etc) to be treated as part of word. Use to enable regular expressions (Regex).
member.param: Index of page for searching. Use -1 to search the entire document.
